author: Karl Bode
description: Cory Gardner, who spent a decade as a Republican senator, has been freshly announced as the CEO of the NCTA–The Internet & Television Association–the cable industry’s biggest lobbying organization. As the revolving door spins you might recall that Gardner is replacing Michael Powell, former FCC boss, whose stint at the agency has largely destroyed government […]
title: Former Republican Senator Cory Gardner Becomes The Cable Industry’s Top Lobbyist

author: Mike Masnick
description: New data from the UK’s age verification rollout provides hard evidence of what internet governance experts have been warning about for years: these laws don’t protect children—they systematically drive users from regulated, compliant platforms to unregulated, non-compliant ones while accomplishing nothing except creating a massive privacy surveillance apparatus. The Washington Post has done the legwork […]
title: UK Age Verification Data Confirms What Critics Always Predicted: Mass Migration To Sketchier Sites

author: Tim Cushing
description: Good lord, here comes another act of preemptive cowardice in service of ensuring the most powerful man in the world enjoys his appearance before a crowd he can’t control or doesn’t own. Here’s Ben Rothenburg of tennis-focused blog Bounces with the scoop: An internal email sent by the U.S. Tennis Association leadership to U.S. Open […]
title: US Open Tells Broadcasters Not To Broadcast Trump Being Booed At The US Open

author: Mike Masnick
description: A longtime open internet activist recently asked me whether I’d reversed my position on internet openness and copyright because of AI. The question caught me off guard—until I realized what he was seeing. Across the tech policy world, people who spent decades fighting for an open, accessible internet are now cheering as that same internet […]
title: We’re Walling Off The Open Internet To Stop AI—And It May End Up Breaking Everything Else

author: Daily Deal
description: Achieve picture perfection with Adobe Photoshop Elements 2025. You can create with stylish effects and templates, and be creative on the go. With the magic of AI and automation behind the scenes, it’s never been easier to fix flaws, fine-tune specific areas, and add motion to quickly bring your vision to life. Get a 3-year […]
title: Daily Deal: Adobe Photoshop Elements 2025 3-Year License

author: Tim Cushing
description: I, for one, cannot wait for the commenters to show up to call this headline hyperbole. mfers please. Why don’t you just read it for yourselves, in your own god-king’s words and images: So, what are we looking at here, you might be asking if the embed didn’t load or you’ve averted your eyes in […]
title: The Trump Administration Declares War On Chicago

author: Karl Bode
description: Last year Trump Republicans killed a popular program that provided poor people with $30 off of their monthly broadband bill. The FCC’s Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) had broad, bipartisan support, and more than 23 million Americans received the discount at its peak. At the time, the GOP claimed they were simply looking to save money. The real reason, of […]
title: Republicans Killed A Low-Income Broadband Program For The Poor, Now Charter Is Being Sued For Misrepresenting Its Impact
